verses.text: Woe be unto \add the\add* pastors that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel against the pastors that feed my people; Ye have scattered my flock, and driven them away, and have not visited them: behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
And I will set up shepherds over them which shall feed them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they be lacking, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Behold, the days come, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.
In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely: and this \add is\add* his name whereby he shall be called, THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
Therefore behold, the days come, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, that they shall no more say, The \sc Lord\sc* liveth, which brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;

but, The \sc Lord\sc* liveth, which brought up and which led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all countries whither I had driven them; and they shall dwell in their own land.

Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets; All my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, And like a man whom wine hath overcome, Because of the \sc Lord\sc*, and because of the words of his holiness.

For the land is full \add of\add* adulterers; For because of swearing the land mourneth; The pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up, And their course is evil, and their force \add is\add* not right.
For both prophet and priest are profane; Yea, in my house have I found their wickedness, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery \add ways\add* in the darkness: They shall be driven on, and fall therein: For I will bring evil upon them, \add even\add* the year of their visitation, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; They prophesied in Baal, And caused my people Israel to err.

I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem a horrible thing: \add They\add* commit adultery, and walk in lies: They strengthen also the hands of evildoers, That none doth return from his wickedness: They are all of them unto me as Sodom, And the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.

Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts concerning the prophets; Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water of gall: for from the prophets of Jerusalem is profaneness gone forth into all the land.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they make you vain: they speak a vision of their own heart, \add and\add* not out of the mouth of the \sc Lord\sc*.

They say still unto them that despise me, The \sc Lord\sc* hath said, Ye shall have peace; and they say \add unto\add* every one that walketh after the imagination of his own heart, No evil shall come upon you.
For who hath stood in the counsel of the \sc Lord\sc*, and hath perceived and heard his word? who hath marked his word, and heard \add it?\add*
Behold, a whirlwind of the \sc Lord\sc* is gone forth \add in\add* fury, even a grievous whirlwind: it shall fall grievously upon the head of the wicked.
The anger of the \sc Lord\sc* shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.
I have not sent \add these\add* prophets, yet they ran: I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.
But if they had stood in my counsel, and had caused my people to hear my words, then they should have turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.
\add Am\add* I a God at hand, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, and not a God afar off?
Can any hide himself in secret places that I shall not see him? saith the \sc Lord\sc*. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
I have heard what the prophets said, that prophesy lies in my name, saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.
How long shall \add this\add* be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies? yea, \add they are\add* prophets of the deceit of their own heart;
which think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbour, as their fathers have forgotten my name for Baal.
The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What \add is\add* the chaff to the wheat? saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
\add Is\add* not my word like as a fire? saith the \sc Lord\sc*; and like a hammer \add that\add* breaketh the rock in pieces?
Therefore behold, I \add am\add* against the prophets, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, that steal my words every one from his neighbour.
Behold, I \add am\add* against the prophets, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.

Behold, I \add am\add* against them that prophesy false dreams, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their lightness; yet I sent them not, nor commanded them: therefore they shall not profit this people at all, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What \add is\add* the burden of the \sc Lord\sc*? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden? I will even forsake you, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
And \add as for\add* the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that shall say, The burden of the \sc Lord\sc*, I will even punish that man and his house.
Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbour, and every one to his brother, What hath the \sc Lord\sc* answered? and, What hath the \sc Lord\sc* spoken?
And the burden of the \sc Lord\sc* shall ye mention no more: for every manâ€™s word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted the words of the living God, of the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts our God.
Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath the \sc Lord\sc* answered thee? and, What hath the \sc Lord\sc* spoken?

But sith ye say, The burden of the \sc Lord\sc*; therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Because you say this word, The burden of the \sc Lord\sc*, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of the \sc Lord\sc*;
therefore behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you, and I will forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, \add and cast you\add* out of my presence:
and I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
